website_summaries.verdict: Showcasing remarkable materials and support, this popular product remains a fan favorite among gymnasts and athletes alike.
pros: Includes a carrying pouch for simple transport
Buyers appreciate the high-quality leather grips
cons: Can be a bit difficult to take off of wrists

customer_reviews.title: The leather itself is great. It helps a lot with grip and seems ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these grips for cross fit and was really looking forward to using them. The leather itself is great. It helps a lot with grip and seems to be good quality. However, the wrist wrap is lacking for me. It does not conform well to my wrist and the plastic piece on the strap tends to hurt the bone on the lateral aspect of my wrist while working out. There is no wrist support as the strap is much too thin. All in all I will keep using these for a while and try to break them in and see if they get any better.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Frayed on first use
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed. I wore them for the first time today and they frayed!! They also rub on the fingers next to the ones in the finger holes and irritate the skin. I wish I could return them as I can not wear them now that they are frayed :(
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S.

customer_reviews.title: Good straps for support
customer_reviews.text: These do *alright* to help reduce some wear on the palms, particularly on pullups. I don't cross-fit, so I can't tell you how they may help for those activities. But for basic weightlifting and pullups, they do seem to help although the finger holes took a while to "shape" to my fingers. I don't have large fingers, so that's something to keep in mind. They add a little support in a restrictive-sense to keep the hands somewhat rigid so as not to strain the wrists, which I find helpful. The wrist straps are hard to get right, but if you had a buddy help then that would solve that problem.
customer_reviews.author: 17keos

customer_reviews.title: I don't like wearing gloves or taking them off and on during ...
customer_reviews.text: Started getting calluses and tears from the various pull up bars at the gym. These took care of it. I don't like wearing gloves or taking them off and on during metcons so I loosen up the strap, and after the pull up portion shove them out of the way in the wrist strap. It takes a second to take on and off vs gloves. There was chafing of the leather on my clothes occasionally, I'm expecting that to stop with use, otherwise I'd look for a died darker cooler in the future, since I normally wear dark clothes when working out.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: So in this regards a good product. However having used mine for several weeks ...
customer_reviews.text: Do they help with grip? Yes. Do they help avoid splitting open your hands during heavy workouts? Yes. So in this regards a good product. However having used mine for several weeks i am surprised at how quickly they are deteriorating. Also the straps are small and if put on too tight will leave marks / bruises on your wrists - especially during WODs with a lot of wrist movement. There are alternatives out there that offer much more wrist support whilst protecting your hands and offering more grip.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: The product was better than I could have imagined. They came in a nice package and were delivered rapidly. They fit very comfortably and I was able to use them this morning for the first time. I would recommend this product to pretty much anybody I knew that's how great it was! Not only is the product made excellently but the company it comes from was very sweet and reaching out to me for my order! I will 100% be ordering from them in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont wait order now
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these after the brutal 16.3. I have had many different types of hand grips before including leather one similar to these. I got these and they are very soft and great quality leather. I was so surprised at the results and very happy to use them. My hands were still ripped but I had to try these out anyway and it was a success. If your thinking about ordering these do not hesitate. Also the customer service thus far has been great. Thanks WODfitters for a great experience and a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Friend

customer_reviews.title: Still get calluses
customer_reviews.text: I used these grips for about a year it Crossfit and will continue using them for now. They provide a good grip, you can easily put them on. I ordered them in small size and they fit me well except that the finger holes are too large. Because they are so large they do not really protect your entire palm from calluses. I still get calluses at the bottom of my fingers..
customer_reviews.author: Rita Art

customer_reviews.title: I finally bought these after tearing my hands doing t2b ...
customer_reviews.text: I finally bought these after tearing my hands doing t2b. Was able to jump back on the bar before properly healing. They also seem to assist with gripping, especially if you use chalk. Edit: the stitches on the fabric that goes around the wrist don't hold up to repeated use. After a month or so of use I dropped the Velcro off when I tried to remove them. I ended up throwing them out. Good while they lasted though.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel Deck

customer_reviews.title: Great for CrossFit
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased these for CrossFit workouts. They are great. I was able to do my workout without the palms of my hands being on fire from the pull up bars. They fit well and provide great grip on the pull up bars and on the barbell.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality Grips.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent alternative for expensive hand grips; and these WODFitters hand grips are quality as well! With previously purchased hand grips from Amazon I've found that the stitching between the velcro and leather tears easily but with these hand grips there is no tearing or poorly made stitching. These are good quality hand grips and protect the pinch points of your hands for less price than the competitor. Do yourself a favor and give these a shot, you'll thank yourself!
customer_reviews.author: JULIO C PEREZ

customer_reviews.title: The best out there
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the price fool you. These grips are so good, I have just purchased my second pair. First one lasted 2 years of Crossfit. Now my wife has a pair and a friend of her is buying a pair. Wife's friend used my second pair for Murph as that was the last workout my originals made (Rest in Peace old friend). As long as these are sold and the price does not go up too much, these are the grips I purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great product and they do what they are supposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product and they do what they are supposed to do. I wear them for crossfit workouts that have a high number of pull ups, toe to bar, etc. They will save your hands. Sometimes I can feel a tear coming on so I will throw them on part way through a workout and will have no issues. Lost a pair and liked them enough to buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Giordano

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good leather
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good price, good leather. Cons: I ripped the stitching that connected the leather to the Velcro material on my second use. I could not help it, but when doing consecutive pull-ups, it kept wanting to grip near the bottom, and the weight of my body would pull the wrist section from the leather section. I bought my wife a pair which she didn't like either, so I used hers. Same thing occurred and so I doubt I got just a faulty pair.
customer_reviews.author: mjsanders21

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Getting ready for the Open, I bought a set for myself and my wife. We both used them this week and absolutely love them! Working through 5.1, and the regular WODs, we have found the grips to be exactly what we had hoped. Although the fingers on mine were a little tight at first, after a few reps, and a little sweat, they were quite comfortable and I almost forgot I was wearing them. I appreciate the timely email with additional usage instructions that appeared in my inbox the same day as the grips arrived! Nice touch!!
customer_reviews.author: MadHatter

customer_reviews.title: these are good and get the job done
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, these are good and get the job done. My hands don't get torn up on Pull ups, rings, and other movements which would rip me. if (as other reviews stated) they put round or oval (finger shaped) holes, it would make them much more comfortable. Also, the plastic loop that secures the velcro will dig in during certain movements. A design like wrist wraps would help with comfort as it could alleviate the digging in that happens sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Wareham

customer_reviews.title: I love these grips
customer_reviews.text: I love these grips! Great for crossfitters! They protect your hands while doing pull ups, toes to bar, toes to rings, kettlebell, and practically any barbell exercise or anything on the rig. I still prefer no grips when doing exercises on the rig but they are great for when your hands are already tore up. The seller is great to work with too. I ordered a medium and needed a small so she sent me a new pair without even making me return the mediums. Answers emails immediately and is very courteous and thankful for your business. I will be dealing with this seller again. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: japazilianbaby

customer_reviews.title: Worked great from the first pull-up!
customer_reviews.text: They worked well from the first pull-up! I'd been told by people that they (generically, not WODFitters grips) can take a while to break in, but I had no such problem. I'll be using this in all my pull-up intensive workouts. My hand happens to measure at the length that's at the boundary between the medium and the large (4 3/4"), and I probably could have gotten away with getting the Medium.
customer_reviews.author: Trey Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Less ripping!
customer_reviews.text: As a person that does Crossfit, my hands always ripped while getting gymnasticy. These have helped tremendously! They dig into my wrists a little while doing high reps but it’s better than having ripped hands! However, these haven’t prevented all rips. I have ripped a few times while wearing these grips.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: While I like mine better
customer_reviews.text: These hand grips are equal to the task they were designed to do. If you are a Crossfitter on a budget, or don't need the frills, this product will suit you well. If you are going to spend a lot of time on the bar, then you might (but not assuredly) want to spend the extra $10 to get a step up. I purchased this set for my wife, and spent the extra money for a higher-end brand because my size was not available. While I like mine better, I think the quality for very good for the price, and very comparable for the amount of work she spends on the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Help keep calluses from palms when lifting heavy weights. Much cooler than wearing a full glove.
customer_reviews.author: brewny

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME customer service and product!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these!! I would order a million more times from this seller as well. My palm measures 3.25 inches, so I tried the small- they were too big. The seller had emailed me to make sure I was happy with the product. I let them know that they fit a little too big and thought the extra small would work better for me. They sent me the extra smalls for NO CHARGE at all within a week. The extra smalls fit perfect! I highly recommend this product for gymnastic movements as well as just plain ole' lifting- great protection for your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I used these gloves once to workout. 20 minutes into the workout, I had to take them off. They are ill fitting - kept moving around my fingers and bunching up, not providing the protection for my hands.
customer_reviews.author: BML

customer_reviews.title: Hand Grips
customer_reviews.text: I virtually only use these for bar work (PUs, MUs, TTB), but these grips are the full package. I have not seriously ripped my palm since using these and have not seen any breakdown of the material or the straps. I would highly recommend these for athletes of all levels because they eliminate the need to worry about slippery bars or pain from over-calloused hands. Of course you will have some minor tears in the skin (friction still applies), but they have eliminated any fear I've had going into bar workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quite OK but expected better for the price
customer_reviews.text: The product is quite OK but I would expect something more comfortable for the price. The holes for the fingers are too long so when you grab the bar the base of your finger (where it hurts most) is exposed. Also the shape of the hole is quite painful between the fingers. In the end it is a good basic product but maybe a bit expensive for the finish, if it is on offer it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: Just tried them for the first time on my WOD today. It's hard to say how well they'll hold up but they seem solid. My only criticism so far is that craftsmanship doesn't look very professional aside from the velcro strap. They look like someone cut them out by hand and sewed on the straps. That said, they were better than the hand made grips I was using made from tape.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Blisters between fingers and sores around wrists.
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY THESE! They leave blood blisters between the fingers along with some nasty sore around the wrists. Honestly, I just tossed them away instead of sending them back. I tried using these to protect my hands from tearing and instead of tears, I got sores between my fingers and around my wrists. The wrist straps are a sharp strip of Velcro. Yes, I did have the right size. I guess if you need them for two pull-ups or something, they work. Anything more, they're just awful.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Might be good for other bar work but I didn't like it ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these for use with pullups. I originally got the wrong size and emailed the company. They immediately sent me the other size with no problems. but the place for the fingerholes is too wide and it tends to rub the inside of the pinkie fingers and the index fingers. And I accidently got the leather wet on one of them and it became so stiff. Might be good for other bar work but I didn't like it for pull ups.
customer_reviews.author: Dell Shepard

customer_reviews.title: They provide good grip while still making me focus on forearm strength
customer_reviews.text: I'm in Afghanistan and they were shipped promptly and arrived in only 8 days. I've used them on Kettle bell days and on pullups because the bar that is available is small and the knurling is about worn out. They provide good grip while still making me focus on forearm strength, unlike lifting straps. The leather is thick, I had to adjust the hole size slightly for larger hands. I do think that the wrist strap velcro could be slightly thicker. Overall, I like them and I'll continue to use them!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy B. Vercher

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I tore my hands up on July 4th doing the Bradshaw workout and thought I would be out of commission for awhile. bought these and was rope climbing the next day. I recommend these for any workout with heavy pullups (especially if you butterfly or kip)/bar hanging movements/rope climbs/rings etc. One note on the size, I'm technically between a small and medium and went with the smaller size as some other reviews recommended and it's been great for me. They will stretch a little when you sweat a lot, but they stay put perfectly. Couldn't be happier with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Mergenthal

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love these!!! I ripped my calluses open and needed something to help cover them until they healed. I was worried it would create too much grip and be almost like a cheat but not at all. You can still feel and grip the bar and my calluses are healing so much faster!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great for KB training
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to exclusively work out with kettlebells because I was tired of my hands getting torn up therefore preventing me from finishing my WOD. For KB training these work great in my opinion. I highly recommend if you have easily torn palms like I do. Only thing that's uncomfortable is the wrist wrap portion of the WODFitters when doing KB cleans and snatches- because the bell rests on the back portion of the forearm and the wrist wrap cuts off a bit of circulation, there's slight discomfort. But when that happens i just unwrap the wrist wrap and just keep the WODFitter on. Would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: they felt good on, got the job done
customer_reviews.text: I wore these grips once, they felt good on, got the job done. I purchased after I ripped my hands open without them. Unfortunately, the plastic part that you pull the velcro through to strap around your wrist, shattered the first time I wore them. I am not sure quality is the best. I am returning and ordering a second pair, I will update my review if these last several months without breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Brink

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner pair to start with though
customer_reviews.text: The leather is of lower quality material. One of the leather pieces is rough on the palm side and after trying to scrape it smooth it still creates blisters on my palm after performing many pullups/muscleups. Good beginner pair to start with though.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: These work just like they should
customer_reviews.text: These work just like they should. Simple, durable. Don't really need the little carrying case, maybe eliminating that could reduce price a bit, but I'm pretty sure that is a way to get the WODFitters name advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Geyer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT customer service & product!
customer_reviews.text: When measured my hands, I could have ordered either the small or medium size. I ordered the medium but when I got them and tried them on, they were a little too big. I was able to return my order and in less than a week get the small, thanks to WODFitters excellent customer service. The grips fit great and work great, and I really like that they come with a case to store them in.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Protection for your hands.
customer_reviews.text: These bad boys come out when I'm going to be doing pull-up work for many repetitions. They weren't comfy at first, but after about an hours work of hanging on the bar, they break in a bit. They saved my hands during Murph.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schrock

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend for crossfit
customer_reviews.text: Tore my hands first use with toes to bar. I do not recommend this product. Totally not even worth the $10.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Nagle

customer_reviews.title: ... or 6 crossfit workouts now I can say I love them. This was a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Having used these in 5 or 6 crossfit workouts now I can say I love them. This was a great purchase. They're simply-designed, comfortable, properly sized and seem to be durable. Best of all they really save your callus area during exercises like toes to bar, pull-ups, kettlebell swings etc. They allow me to do far more reps on these type exercises with far less aggravation (blisters, bleeding, tears) than before. I looked at similar grips that were both more and less money - I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bdizzlenator

customer_reviews.title: Very good option!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for two weeks now, for crossfit (pull-ups, rope climb and T2B mainly), and so far they are working very good. My hands are not free of calluses, but there is no tearing. I was using batting gloves before, which was better for my hands, but my grip was not so good. I recommend this product if you want to have good grip, and you don't mind a little pain (but not tearing).
customer_reviews.author: Rommel Quintero

customer_reviews.title: Love them! I am not a crossfitter myself but ...
customer_reviews.text: Love them! I am not a crossfitter myself but do a lot of power lifting. These have saved my hands. The leather is soft enough that it is comfortable and I like the simple design of the wrist strap. Amazing customer service. You can tell the company really cares about its product being effective and pleasing its customers. Kudos!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Good protection for calisthenics
customer_reviews.text: I don’t crossfit (and have nothing against it). I use them mainly for pull ups, muscle ups and levers training, and sometimes just for playing with the monkey bars. These provide good protection and descent grip on the bar. I still get some calluses witch I think is normal, but no more rips and tears. It takes a workout or two to break in, and they work best with chalk (although I don’t find it necessary) Costumer service is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Naranjo01

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Protects the skin on my hands during pull-ups...works as described.
customer_reviews.author: J-Bones!

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Fit really well. Do what they are meant to do.
customer_reviews.author: gkc

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. I had borrowed someones gymnastic wraps in the gym and loved them. I came and ordered these and have used them for about 3 workouts in the last week. I do crossfit, so I have used them for Pull-ups, Chest to Bars, and Toes to bar so far. I will post later about the quality over time. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Loved
customer_reviews.text: The stitches come up after 5 or 6 moths, i sew it again and works like a charms
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: A few months have gone by and the hand grips have ripped. The Velcro wrist wrap is excruciatingly painful and is where the leather piece has ripped from. I usually have to tape my wrists before I can wear the grips, otherwise instead of getting my hands cut up, my wrists get cut up. I have decided to go with the wodies.
customer_reviews.author: acrags

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a few months then the leather ripped ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a few months then the leather ripped off the strap on one of them, so I now have no way to secure it around my wrist and it just flaps about, which takes extra time and energy to make sure it is set up on the bar correctly every single rep. UPDATE 4/6/2016: WODFitters has shipped me free replacements so I am back in business. I was only expecting one to replace the busted one, but they sent me an entire new set with the bag and everything. Great Customer Service! Hopefully these hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Great set of hand wraps
customer_reviews.text: Great set of hand wraps. I ripped both my hands doing high rep pull ups and was looking for a set of these to keep in my gym bag. They're reasonable priced, well made, well fitting, and perfect for what I needed. I have big hands, measured 8" from base of palm to tip of middle finger and the size large fit me comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Tysonius Maximus

customer_reviews.title: complicated and provide no protection
customer_reviews.text: I get as much pinch on my hands as I do without these. Quite complicated to take on and off when doing a high-intensity workout for time (crossfit)
customer_reviews.author: Armando

customer_reviews.title: Great seller
customer_reviews.text: I wear a different set of these and love them, so I bought these for the wife. She has just started CF so I'm not sure she has even used them yet. These will help you stay on the bar longer and allow for less wear and tear on your hands. Any product from WODFitters I've bought so far has been great though. They sent a $10 gift card with these gloves and are always having promotions if your subscribed with them. Great Amazon seller.
customer_reviews.author: JPR

customer_reviews.title: Every time I use them I get rips and they are merely useless. Look at other grips
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in hopes that my hands would stop tearing. They seemed to help but a couple months down the road, but I might as well been wearing no grips at all. Every time I use them I get rips and they are merely useless. Look at other grips. These are cheap but there is a reason.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Well made, however too big for my small hands ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made, however too big for my small hands and doesn't provide any protection or support so I will probably give them away.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica McNeil

customer_reviews.title: awesome grips for bar work
customer_reviews.text: I have always hated using grips that I borrowed from others and told myself I never wanted to buy my own. I ripped my hands open so badly with kipping t2b that I had no choice but to invest in a pair. Although I have only used these once, I have to say that I am very pleased with them. They didn't feel too thick and didn't get in the way. I was able to complete my workout without ripped up hands and without feeling like something was in my way on the bar. I would definitely recommend these and I look forward to using them on the regular!
customer_reviews.author: The Bees Knees

customer_reviews.title: Best WOD grips hands-down!
customer_reviews.text: These grips are outstanding! Beautiful quality, both materials and workmanship. They're nicely packaged with a nylon storage bag to keep them apart from your sweaty clothes. I've only used them a few times, but based on the robustness of construction, I expect them to last a long time. Quick shipping and excellent seller communication. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Rufus

customer_reviews.title: They Don't Stink.
customer_reviews.text: This type of hand protection takes aboit an hour or so to get used to. But then when you get the hang of these, there's nothing better. I feel naked without them. They are super tough and last a good while. I'm on my second set. ALSO a bonus with this brand: they don't stink with age.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Wells

customer_reviews.title: Left me Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! These guys really take the pressure off!. I ran these through every possible crossfire move that required my hands, and I am not disappointed. I can also tell that they will continue to adapt as they age, which is a wonderful thing. Great product, great company, will do business again! Very satisfied :)
customer_reviews.author: S&L

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend for anyone who has trouble gripping the bar due ...
customer_reviews.text: As a prolific sweater I was really looking for something to help me keep my grip during high volume pull-ups without excess chalking. From that perspective they worked well and during a 5 round 15 c2b pull-up workout wearing these my grip was not a problem and only needed to chalk once. On the down side I still had rips on one hand, but I attribute that more to where I was gripping the bar and my baby hands. Definitely recommend for anyone who has trouble gripping the bar due to sweaty hands.
customer_reviews.author: shutsal

customer_reviews.title: compared to natural grips they stay on better when i sweat a lot
customer_reviews.text: compared to natural grips they stay on better when i sweat a lot. They shift little on pullup bar work but the wrist straps keep them in pretty much in place. Hand measured 4.5" so i went with the Medium and they fit proper.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Delosh

customer_reviews.title: Crossfit life changers!
customer_reviews.text: These WODFitters are AMAZING. I do crossfit daily , and let's be honest, we all work up a crazy sweat during the WOD. During pull-ups, toes 2 bars, and even gripping the barbell was tough once my hands were sweaty and the chalk just gunked up. I can actually GRIP everything now much better, finish WODs faster, and I haven't torn a palm yet. These things are amazing and a must buy for an Crossfitter! Go CFTB!
customer_reviews.author: boomer

customer_reviews.title: unfortunately they don't cover the part of my hands that needs to most protection - might just not be the best choice for very small hands
customer_reviews.text: Several people in my gym use these and rave about them, unfortunately they don't cover the part of my hands that needs to most protection - might just not be the best choice for very small hands.
customer_reviews.author: Michael don mccloud

customer_reviews.title: Great Grips!!!
customer_reviews.text: These WODFitters' Hand Grips are the best! I had a pair of these exact same grips until my dog ripped them apart. I bought a different brand of leather hand grips that was recommended to me by someone at my XFIT gym and I will say, they are not as good as these. The leather was great but the plastic piece that allows you to tighten/loosen the velcro strap would dig into my skin while performing pull ups and other moves. The small plastic piece on the WODFitters' Hand Grips DOES NOT dig into the skin while maintaining strong grips around bars and other things CrossFitters throw around!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Solberg

customer_reviews.title: Great grips
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. Even if you don't wear them for an entire workout, all you need is a set or two with these, then you can finish without them and still not rip. I ordered the smallest size to avoid bunching and that was a GREAT idea. I would go at least a size smaller than what you think.
customer_reviews.author: Romey1911

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Grip and Confortable
customer_reviews.text: 1st WOD using the WODFITTERS handgrips, and they surpassed my expectations. They have an awesome grip (tried them on the barbells, power cleans, deadlifts and when i hit the toes to bar I just felt like I was glued to the bar. Excellent product! They are quite comfortable, I even did burpees and felt no restrain. I would certainly reccomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nir

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit and good quality
customer_reviews.text: These hand grips have allowed me to cycle barbell movements much faster now and allow me to be more effective and efficient during my lifts. Comfortable fit and good quality. Bought two different pairs, one for me and another for my wife and she loves them as well. Thank you WODFitters for the quality merchandise.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Pullup
customer_reviews.text: Wish they were three hole to cover my hands better. I've still not figured out how to use them to keep my hands from getting blisters. But would recommend to protect your hands
customer_reviews.author: leeh

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: (Jennifer's Husband). These did the job well enough, but I ripped one in half doing pull-ups after 3 months of use. I am a CF'er and use these on pull-ups (usually kipping) and toes to bar primarily, which appear in our WOD's 1-2 times/week. So not like I was using them constantly. I was disappointed in how quickly I destroyed them. I am a 200lb male, so maybe just too much for them. But for a low price, I'll just keep going with another pair. I'll probably also pay more attention to keeping the leather from coming under tension/not putting my weight on it at the wrist. Curious how long these have lasted other folks.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer P. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Good set -- plastic piece can rub the wrong way
customer_reviews.text: All and all -- my wife loves these. Her only complaint is that the plastic piece digs into her wrists. It's deterred her from wearing them a few times. My understanding is that it's pretty common with these types of straps.
customer_reviews.author: Canaan F.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, thin straps
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap made but def saved my hands . I would've paid a little more for some better quality wraps that actually cover my wrist with a full strap. These thing little straps don't feel that secure or comfy but, It does do the trick and hold well.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Offer protection where needed and lets your hand breathe and feel cool.
customer_reviews.text: I used to do gymnastics as a kid and these was the type of protection we used. It kinda feels weird at the beginning, but once you use them a few times and get loose, they feel great. I have pretty big hands and had tried different gloves and even the gym paws, but all of them felt uncomfortable and the gym paws keep sliding away from my palm while doing kipping pull ups or muscle ups. I definetely recommend you giving these a try.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mick

customer_reviews.title: They also smell pretty funky out of the bag
customer_reviews.text: These grips don't do anything for slippery fingers. I was doing Deadlifts and, while they protected my hands from getting more calluses, the bar still slides out of my grip because of slick fingers. They also smell pretty funky out of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: GeniusUnleashed

customer_reviews.title: This wont fit to my hand and very uncomfortable for pull ups
customer_reviews.text: This wont fit to my hand and very uncomfortable for pull ups. I habe ordered a small size and fits my wrist and not the fingers. The cloth used to cover palm is really not good and it won't cover completely. I would defenitely not recommend this product. This is not worth for 20 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: bhaskar

customer_reviews.title: So so...
customer_reviews.text: Fit good and are good for certain workouts.i.e Olympic lifts. I used them for pull ups and toes to bar, my hands got ripped apart. The leather texture doesn't go well when to much movement and pressure is applied for volume, but for Olympic lifts strictly they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I am no longer ripping my palms open! The storage bag that is provided is great to put them away and not get chalk on anything else. I work them doing a few non-palm ripping exercised to wear them in and that did the trick. I haven't ripped my palms open since they arrived. Today is the rope climb and I am thinking of wearing them- I'll let you know how it goes! Great buy- worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product with even better customer service
customer_reviews.text: great product with excellent customer service. I originally ordered the wrong size and they immediately sent me a new one in the correct size. the customer service was incredible. ive used the product already 3-4 times and it works like a charm. id recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tawil

customer_reviews.title: Great grips to avoid ripped calluses.
customer_reviews.text: Have saved my hand from many a ripped callus. Only wish there were sizes because I have really small hands and wish they were a little more tailored to my size. Other than that, they are simple, great quality and have held up very well in many a wod. I recommend them big time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Croft

customer_reviews.title: 20 months of CrossFit style workouts have created a beautiful range of callouses and rip marks on my hands
customer_reviews.text: 20 months of CrossFit style workouts have created a beautiful range of callouses and rip marks on my hands. After another big palm tear I finally decided to invest in a pair of these grips. Fantastic. Battle tested already. Worked on a pull-up rig and with a kettlebell and barbell. Very happy with them. Even a friend borrowed them and liked them enough to inquire about purchasing a pair. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Yunus

customer_reviews.title: I want to love these but one is much thicker than the other ...
customer_reviews.text: I want to love these but one is much thicker than the other which causes problems with my grip on the bar. They are still an improvement over torn hands but would be great if they were both the thickness of the thinner one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. So awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. So awesome. I don't know why I didn't get these sooner. A serious game changer if you're looking to be proactive and protect your hands. Number one rule in gymnastics, "take care of your hands" and these do the job wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Best hand protection ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Totally improved my pull-up, kipping, etc. covers my grip without any hindereance. I can take on and off in seconds during the WOD if needed. Great quality!!! Will purchase another pair immediately if I ever lose mine
customer_reviews.author: marg

customer_reviews.title: The hand grips are just perfect. I ordered them for my wife who continues ...
customer_reviews.text: The hand grips are just perfect. I ordered them for my wife who continues to develop blisters doing her pull ups. This did the trick and I am now her HERO! Thanks WODFitters!
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Grip was nice.
customer_reviews.text: Between bouldering and the pull up bar, my hands are always callused and risk being torn. Finally got a pair of these and used them for the first time yesterday. Heavy kettlebells swings and pulls ups. First workout in a while I wasn't scared of my hands possibly ripping or hurting or scaling because my hands were sore. Grip was nice.
customer_reviews.author: ckdufresne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small hands!
customer_reviews.text: I think these are the only grips for small hands. Seriously, I have tired 3 different grips and they were all too large. :( I used these this morning for the first time and I absolutely LOVE them! I will tell all my CrossFitter friends to purchase these grips because the quality is so great.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Grace

customer_reviews.title: Tore after less than three months.
customer_reviews.text: Product came in on time and as expected. Unfortunately they tore after less than three months of use. I used them on average for 6 workouts a week. For low frequency these would last but I was really sad to see these worn after what felt like a short time ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie C.

customer_reviews.title: but happy with them so far
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these on the recommendation from my coach, they have made a huge difference in my ability to hang on the bar for longer and keep my hands protected. Have not used them for large sets yet, but happy with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: CookFam

customer_reviews.title: Feel Great!
customer_reviews.text: As a CrossFit "newbie", my hands were constantly getting ripped up on movements such as kipping pull-ups, bar work, dead hangs, ect. The leather hand grips were the perfect size and worked well during WOD's. Definitely recommend if you are looking for a quality product to protect your skin!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Saved my hand since day one. They've held up without issue over the last month or two. No ripping, and the sizing chart is spot on. I use mine for crossfit 5 days a week.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Jones

customer_reviews.title: It is amazing how much these save your skin as well as ...
customer_reviews.text: A must for the ladies (or guys) who wear rings. It is amazing how much these save your skin as well as not feeling like your wearing anything. Great feel of the bar without bunching up as weight lifting gloves. The bag is handy so it doesn't get lost in the sauce.
customer_reviews.author: Hen

customer_reviews.title: Great for Training
customer_reviews.text: I've been lifting for about 17 years. Recently got into crossfit style workouts and needed something for my hands. Looked up grips and these came up. I used the sizing chart and placed my order. Order came in as advertised and I wore them the next day. They worked great and I blew through my workout. Highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: These grips work great for pull-ups
customer_reviews.text: These grips work great for pull-ups. I barely notice that they are on my hands; they don't restrict my movements and give me the grip I need. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Lori N

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I've used them several times now and they have saved me a few rips. It is a little harder to grip the bar with these, but they do save your hands. To get better friction out of them, make sure to chalk up the grips first. I like the velcro straps. I can leave them strapped to my wrist, but remove them from my fingers when I don't need them.
customer_reviews.author: Brino

customer_reviews.title: Great for pull-ups.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had gotten ones slightly longer/bigger. So if you are in between, go bigger.
customer_reviews.author: giggler

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: For my first pair. The don't cover up top portion of palms. They don't protect some of the palm. Was disappointed for never owning a pair. I will buy a different pair on next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Shopper

customer_reviews.title: ... out before the skin on my hands gets too painful. Only suggestion
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a few calisthenics/bar workouts and so far they've done the job -- my calluses aren't quite as gnarly as they used to be and I can get some more sets out before the skin on my hands gets too painful. Only suggestion, as others have pointed out, is that round finger holes rather than square might be a little more comfortable. Good product for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a nice price
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a nice price. Bought these for the wife, got the wrong size. Kat was very helpful getting me the correct size even though it was my fault. We ended up buying another set just for home workouts. Extremely responsive and we'll continue to buy from WODFitters going forward.
customer_reviews.author: roger blair

customer_reviews.title: Try for yourself.
customer_reviews.text: I returned them. They were super stiff and rough and seemed like they would slice my hand. I didnt want bloody hands during the breakin period that would likely be required. I am thinking that I'll like non-leather better.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great grips, but the leather is hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: I love this WOD grips, however one of the grips is a nice soft leather, and the other is a harder (poorer quality) leather. Hard on the pull-up bars
customer_reviews.author: tentoes

customer_reviews.title: ... up bar if you have medium to small hands like mine. I'd go with a glove option instead
customer_reviews.text: I use these for pull ups at crossfit gym and the thickness of these make it difficult to grip pull up bar if you have medium to small hands like mine. I'd go with a glove option instead.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: I've only used them once so far, and they ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only used them once so far, and they seem to do the trick as far as protecting my hands and making the kettle bell flow smoothly. The problem I found is that the material between the fingers is quite stiff and is uncomfortable at first. While I'm sure it will soften with use, I did have to cut it down a little. I imagine, even when it's softer it will still be a bit bulky.
customer_reviews.author: joannef

customer_reviews.title: Fits weird but serves their purpose
customer_reviews.text: Serves their purpose.. My only complaint is the finger holes fit weird and rub since the shape is square rather than round. The Palm guard fits well and wrist strap is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Selena

product_meta.title: WODFitters Textured Leather Hand Grips for Cross Training, Kettlebells, Powerlifting, Chin Ups, Pull Ups, WODs & Gymnastics – with Grips Storage Pouch
product_meta.description:
Grip Better, Get Stronger Faster With WODFitters Textured Leather Hand Grips 

While they initially appear as a minor nuisance, calluses gradually become a veritable threat to your overall fitness. 

Not taking care of your hands can turn you from an active athlete to a passive spectator, unable to reverse the long-term damage sustained from loose gripping and incomplete hand healing. 

Take Action & Protect Your Hands With These Ergonomic Hand Grips, Today. 

Designed to fit men and women alike, these grips are made for working out HARD. 

Their textured leather surface eliminates the possibility of ripping out your skin and exposing pre-formed calluses, helping you grip firmly and finish every last rep, like a champ. 

No matter the workout, your hands will always remain 100% protected. See your personal times decrease and your comfort levels go through the roof, wearing the WODFitters grips will feel like second skin, only one that makes you perform better! 

Multi-Tasking & Convenient 

Weightlifting, kettleball swings, pull ups, chin ups, toes-to-bar, bar muscle ups, ring dips or ANY type of exercise where your chance to become your best self literally relies on your hands, these grips will be your best ally for continuous improvement and tremendous fitness results. 

What You’ll Receive: 

- 1 x Pair Of WODFitters Textured Leather Hand Grips 
- 1 x Grips Storage Pouch 

Grips Sizing Specifications: 

- Small: Up to 4", 
- Medium: For 4" to 4 3/4” 
- Large: For over 4 3/4" 

Consult Our Size Guide & Choose Your Own Pair NOW! 

Click Add To Cart Before We Run Out Of Stock!
feature_bullets: Protect your hands during high rep pull-ups, toes-to-bar, bar muscle ups, ring dips, kettlebell swings, and other movements that are hard on your hands
Eliminate the risk of getting and ripping off calluses while doing pull up Heavy WODs.
Reduce slippage from the bar with textured leather on both sides.
Comfortable fit with a convenient hook-and-loop strap.
Comes with convenient carrying case and 100% satisfaction guarantee!
